summary: This is an email chain from April 8, 2021, regarding an FBI request for agents to assist with monitoring Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team during a three-day evidence review at the courthouse from April 13-15, 2021. It details the logistical arrangements, including security protocols and room assignments.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant whose defense team is scheduled to review evidence at the courthouse; she will be produced by the Marshals and monitored by FBI agents.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Will be present for the evidence review and reserved the proffer rooms for the proceedings.

connections.description: Prosecutor (AUSA) overseeing the evidence review process involving the defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Start of Maxwell Evidence Review
events.description: Maxwell and her defense team begin reviewing evidence in the proffer room area on the 5th floor of the courthouse, monitored by FBI agents.

events.title: FBI Agent Assistance Period
events.description: FBI agents are requested to assist with monitoring Maxwell and her defense team during the evidence review from April 13-15, 2021.

keyFacts: The FBI's Squad C-20 requested 2-3 agents to assist with monitoring Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team during a scheduled evidence review from April 13-15, 2021.
Maxwell was to be produced by the Marshals each morning around 9:30 AM and required an FBI agent with a handcuff key to escort and monitor her, including bathroom breaks.
Three proffer rooms were reserved: one for evidence review, one for private defense conferences, and one as a break area for agents and AUSAs.
The email indicates coordinated logistical planning between the FBI, U.S. Marshals, and the U.S. Attorney's Office for a high-profile defendant's pretrial proceedings.
